citation.article-title: Proposal to reclassify [Sphingomonas] xenophaga Stolz et al. 2000 and [Sphingomonas] taejonensis Lee et al. 2001 as Sphingobium xenophagum comb. nov. and Sphingopyxis taejonensis comb. nov., respectively.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Sphingopyxis taejonensis (Lee et al. 2001) comb. nov.
Sphingopyxis taejonensis (tae.jon.enâ€²sis. N.L. fem. adj. taejonensis referring to Taejon, Korea, the geographical origin of the type strain).
Basonym: Sphingomonas taejonensis Lee et al. 2001.
The description is identical to the description given for Sphingomonas taejonensis by Lee et al. (2001).
